p: The planning of any intervention on phytosanitary matters - for the great variety of the subjects involved - includes the management of a large quantity and quality of information and parameters with different levels of uncertainty and the need to build a dialogue between stakeholders, analysts, and scientists. For these purposes, the use of multicriteria decision analysis (MCDA), as a set of formal approaches, which seek to explicitly take into account multiple criteria in helping individuals or groups to explore the decisions that matter [ 30] is widespread [ 31].
